description: In this course, students examine the ethical underpinnings of the sustainable development concept; explore the interdependence of society and environment in a variety of contexts (primarily but not exclusively in "developing" countries); learn about the social factors that have led economic growth to be particularly unsustainable, especially with respect to the environment. Offered annually in the spring semester. Prerequisite: ENVST 137.
name: Sustainable Development
notes: Students that have not met the prerequisite are welcome to register.
